title: Design Pattern Application for Monitoring and Evaluating CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) Interactions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and understanding of CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) concepts
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment centered on smartphone-based activities, utilizing workplace-relevant case studies aligned with professionals' job responsibilities

learning_goals: Learners can explain five key metrics (quantitative/qualitative) for monitoring CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) interactions.
Learners can design at least three evaluation systems for CSCL interactions by applying design patterns (DP).
Learners can present a two-step or more process for utilizing CSCL monitoring tools implementable in smartphone environments.
Learners can categorize feedback for improving teamwork into three types through learning data analysis.

resources: Open-source CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) analysis tool
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
